Hi, I'm Julian

Data Scientist

I am a results-driven coder with an inclination towards software development, in my current role and also as a hobby.




About Me

I am excited for you to view some of my work. I am passionate about using technology to improve our health and environment, and seek to do this every day in my career.

But first, a little bit about me. I'm 27 years old and was born in York, UK. I am a keen traveller and am always thinking about my next trip! In my free time I like to read novels, play video games (anything FromSoftware or Zelda), cook, play piano, see friends and family, and go hiking. I am also part of a hiking group and love going on excursions with them.

I am excited for you to view some of my work. I am passionate about using technology to improve our health and environment, and seek to do this every day in my career.

My skill set spans data science, full-stack development, and team leadership to solve complex business problems. My key skills include:

  • Languages: Python, SQL, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Libraries and Frameworks: Experienced in utilizing NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Jupyter Notebook, Scikit, PyTorch, BeautifulSoup, React.js, Node.js, Flask, FastAPI, and Docker.
  • Machine Learning Models: SVMs, Logistic and Linear Regression, Random Forest, Decision Trees, CNNs, and XGBoosting models.
  • Specialisations: Natural Language Processing and Image Processing.
  • Process Knowledge: Testing, GIT, Azure, Agile methodologies, Scrum, and Backlog to Done process.


Contributions

ContactEngine

  • Teams bot message creator: I used Flask, Docker and OpenAI to create a program to automatically generate a response message for agents to use, given a customer's previous interactions. This led to a reduction in time spent on cases by 95% where the customer's response triggered an unknown intent..
  • Data analysis project: Conducted data analysis on unknown responses (inbound messages that did not trigger a known intent), and used sentiment analysis to cluster them. The addition of new intents led to a reduction in cases by 45%.
  • Hackathon 2023 winner: With my idea to use OpenAI to assist agents in generating messages for unknown intents, our team won the hackathon, winning a prize of a $200 Amazon voucher. This gave rise to the implementation of it in a teams bot which I also did.
  • Data pipeline automation: I recently took the lead on automating our pipeline deployment code, bolstering efficiency and accessibility to more users.
  • Benchmarking machine learning techniques: I also compared our sophisticated transformer-based models against more basic models like SVMs, RFs, and CNNs. The results weren't optimal, but at least we now that our expensive methods are not wasted.
  • Being recognised: I make sure to build connections wherever I go, and this did not stop at this company. I led training sessions, gave presentations to the company, and also led the Town Hall meeting a few times.

The United Nations

  • Relational database transition: I led the change from Google Sheets to a relational database system. This bolstered data integrity and ensured that data loss was kept to a minimum.
  • Automated data analysis: I created a Python program using PySimpleGUI for automated data analysis. The user would then upload two csv files, and the Python program would join them, clean the data, and output results. I also included a troubleshooting guide.
  • Data analysis: I conducted data analysis on a survey using the SurveyMonkey API, summarising age, sex, sector and other relevant factors to assess bias across the workforce regarding overtime working. I then used sentiment analysis to provide insights about general attitudes/themes towards working in general to feed forward to management.
  • ENZA convening team: As a key member of the ENZA (Entertainment Net Zero Accord) team, I played a critical role in engaging with stakeholders throughout the entertainment industry to support efforts aimed at reducing carbon emissions. Working with BAFTA and UNESCO, I helped reduce carbon emissions at events by 12%.
  • CNN promotion: I led the promotion of the Climate Neutral Now! Initiative by engaging with corporations, institutions, and events. I was the contact point for the initiative, and welcomed any questions that stakeholders had. I increased signatories by 20%.
  • COP26: I had the privilege of attending COP26 in Glasgow, where I played an instrumental role in organising and participating in various events. From booking rooms to coordinating with representatives from corporations, institutions, and other organisations, I was responsible for ensuring the smooth execution of each event.
